article: In Britain, people have different attitudes to the police. Most people generally _ them and the job they do - although there are certain people who do not believe that the police should have that power. What does a policeman _ do? A policeman often has to _ traffic, either on foot in the center of a town, or in a police car on the roads.5 _ , in Britain, he might even be in the Traffic Police and spend a lot of his time _ up and down main roads and motorways. A traffic policeman has to help keep the traffic moving, stop _ motorists and help when there is an accident. A policeman has to help keep the _ , too. If there is a fight or some other disturbance, we _ the police to come and restore order. And they often have to deal with situation at great risk of their own _ . We expect the police to solve _ , of course, so a(n) _ policeman, even if he is not a detective , will often have to help _ for and arrest criminals. And who do we call when there is an emergency - an air crash, a burning _ , a road accident, or a robbery? We call the _ . So a policeman has to be _ to face any unpleasant emergency that may happen in the modern world. The police do an ly _ job. They do it _ well and I support them, but I do not envy policemen, I do not think that I could ever do the job of a _ .
